title: Warwick, a Good Guy?
body:
Today I was rolling up a Warwick character for Pathfinder, having already created Twitch. And while listening to a few of his quotes and looking at my alignment chart. After what I've heard and thought of, even going in line with his background...It seems the Warwick we have today falls squarely under Chaotic Good. The descriptor from the part goes 

_Chaotic Good people have absolutely no regard for laws or social structures and will pursue what they think is right at any cost. Their lives are guided by what they think is right and good, and they have little time for those who see the world any differently. They're also willing to do bad things to bad people._

Given that and these select quotes directed to Champions and during movements and attacking...

------------------------------

{{champion:254}} "Zaun needed you!" ( Obvious resent for Vi leaving Zaun to rot )

{{champion:245}}  "The one person in Zaun who runs to the past!" ( Obviously he resents Ekko for not trying to better Zaun in a more proactive way )

--------------------------

{{champion:19}} ( Attacking )
"If you die, how many live?" ( The thought of 'One for the good of the many' )
"The killing stops when Zaun is free" ( Proof is in the pudding here guys )
"You hurt them, I hurt you" ( His idea of 'Eye for an eye' )

------------------------------------------

{{champion:19}} ( Bloodhunt Passive )

"Can't save you all...Don't want to" ( My belief is that he struggles with the weight of trying to make Zaun a better place and falling into a murderous rampage )

"I became...Monster" ( Part of his human mind still terrified of what he's become )
"In...control!" ( Another part of his human mind that trys to wrestle control from 'The Beast' )
"Try...Hide!" ( My belief that his human mind is trying to tell his target to hide while 'The Beast' is wanting a challenge, wanting them to try )

-------------------------------------------

{{champion:19}} ( Movement )

"Zaun will watch you bleed, and it will do nothing" ( Zaun, to Warwick, is a being capable of change, so much so that it won't try and help criminals if they're dying )

"Zaun will fight back!" ( Leading back to Zaun being alive concept. Zaun wants to be clean and wants to be just as prosperous as Piltover or even Demacia )

------------------------------------------------

Through this evidence, what Warwick tries to do for Zaun despite his appearance, I've found that without a shadow of a doubt that Warwick _is_ another "Hero" of Zaun

replies.body:
I disagree with Warwick being Chaotic Good. Here's why:

> Their lives are guided by what they think is right and good,

Warwick is guided by no such thing. He doesn't think his actions are the right thing to do. He doesn't justify his actions with the idea of one day achieving a peaceful future. He has no endgame.

Warwick does not kill and maim people because he thinks it serves a good purpose. He kills people because that apparatus he wears on his back _forces_ him to. Killing is what he's made for, and he can't stop killing any more than a human can stop eating or drinking.
His only redemption is that he tries to aim himself towards those he thinks deserves it (other criminals) and he's not all too reliable at that.

Imagine a Zaun that had no criminals for Warwick to hunt. He wouldn't retire. He'd start killing any civilian who crossed his path, because death and violence is what he was made for.


Maybe Warwick is lawful evil? A monster who limits himself to hunting other monsters.
Or perhaps chaotic neutral?
Or maybe characters like Warwick are too complex to be assigned a single label.
I am unfamiliar with Pathfinder, but I thought I'd add my two pence.

Well but he does try to aim his violent urges towards criminals,because he wants to do the right thing.

Yes the machine makes it hard for him to "aim" his actions,but that doesn't change the intention behind them.

He is like a DND werewolf who has not accepted the curse and whose alignment thus didn't change.He is basically chaotic good(or maybe neutral?)outside of battles and during his frenzies he is chaotic evil

It would seem that Warwick is of two minds so that is highly possible. He could be treating The Beast as a weapon and when he feels and urge to kill he aims it at them to give a meaning to the madness

One of Warwick's quotes attribute that he still remembers who he was before becoming 'The Beast' 

While I do agree that Warwick wouldn't stop killing people, I do not agree that he would just go and kill civilians. Warwick, to my belief, would have better knowledge who is inherently bad and who isn't. That's why he doesn't think of Piltover people as 'good' because they only serve themselves rather than their people, being only a byproduct to their own means. ( Ala Camille and Caitlyn )

Warwick, if Zaun was liberated from gangs, would probably wander Runeterra for the hunt of criminals, most likely finding his way to Noxus where he would either die or be broken as a Hound of War. 

But if I were to attribute him to anything other than Chaotic Good, it would most likely be Neutral Evil. An excerpt 

"...act soley in their own interests..." 

Either way it's something to think and debate about

> Warwick, to my belief, would have better knowledge who is inherently bad and who isn't. 

Agreed. But Warwick's need to kill is a chemical addiction, not a choice. Whether his victims are good or bad people doesn't factor into it. This is why I think he would attack civilians (and why he already has attacked civilians): the blood scent drives him mad, and eventually the human side of him can't hold the beast back.

> Warwick, if Zaun was liberated from gangs, would probably wander Runeterra for the hunt of criminals, most likely finding his way to Noxus where he would either die or be broken as a Hound of War. 

I really like this idea. The human part of Warwick, realising he can no longer funnel his rage and hunger into the criminals of Zaun, just fleeing Zaun/Piltover entirely so he doesn't start running amok in the streets. I imagine he would only get worse in the wilderness with such long periods of isolation, but it would ultimately be a noble sacrifice on his part.

By the way, I really disagree with your comment about Camille and Caitlyn only serving their own needs, but I suppose that is a discussion for another thread.

One of Warwick's taunts to Caitlyn is

"You're so deep in piltovers pockets I can only see your hat"

Camille is more on the edge of No, but I heavily believe Caitlyn is corrupt in some manner no matter how she acts
Keep in mind though that this is from his perspective, not objective fact.
Looking back on it and really thinking he could be just highly skeptical that any person of the law is good, after all he's still a Zaunite

I mean, did you read his long lore (bio + color story)?

It's rather explicitly said that Warwick *was* a good guy, but he is now almost completely controlled by the apparatus on his back. So, I'm not entirely sure what you are trying to argue here?

If it's just that Warwick falls in the "Chaotic Good" alignment, I disagree. My opinion is that talking about his moral alignment is kind of pointless since he is not entirely conscious/responsible of his own action.

I'd say Jinx being chaotic neutral isn't that clear at all.
After all causing destruction without a cause is generally considered evil as it still harms others,even if it doesn't inflict physical harm.

Similar one could say that Vayne falls more into the evil category as it looks more like she hunts dark magic users for her own enjoyment rather than to protect others and Akali probably falls more under lawful neutral,because as far as we know she does follow the teachings of the kinkou.

What defines neutral is that while they don't put it as a particularly high concern, they do have a moral compass. They won't go out of their way to do good deeds just for the sake of goodness nor commit heinous acts out of mean spiritness. How far they are willing to go is defnitely something we have to consider.

So I can't really see Jinx as being evil, she isn't out to spread misery and suffering as an end. Her end goal isn't evil, she's out to have fun and her fun ins't in the evil itself (like say, Shaco). She isn't willing (or interested) in anything too far down the scale either (unlike say Gangplank, who has no qualms about carving the bones of a fully conscious man).

Vayne is a similar case, her end goal isn't evil (getting rid of dark magicks is arguably good), and while she obviously begun enjoying herself, she doesn't target innocents and she definitely is above comitting outright evil acts. For instance while she would have no qualms about inflcting pain or killing somebody using dark magicks (and she would actually enjoy it), I don't think she would ever do the same to an innocent person. She goes even out of her way to make 100% sure the people she kills are indeed guilty (like with the shapechanger's wife).

As for Akali, yeah you're 100% right. Actually now that I think about it she is probably THE best example of a lawful neutral character because her code is literally the only concern she has. A better true neutral would be I guess Aureilon Sol. Maybe MIss Fortune.

No, because killing for fun is an evil act quite high on the scale. The neutral alignment exists exactly because things aren't cut and dry binary. Somebody who kills for fun is evil, but somebody who steals for fun is neutral because while stealing is evil, it's not too evil. It's a scale after all, so we have to consider how far either way the action is.

>But does she really only go after guilty people?Frey,the person who basically adopted Vayne,saved her life and taught her everything to hunt down others was killed by Vayne without any second thoughts. Yes Frey used dark magic to increase her abilities,but is she automatically evil because of that?

That's what makes her neutral and not good. She is so fanatical about her aversion to dark magicks that anyone who uses it is irrevocably guilty, and Vayne is 100% sure that Frey dealt with it, and willingly at that because she confessed so. That's more of a case of lack of mercy than evil intent.

Yeah, and then the question would be what is her main motivation. Someone who wants to kill and inflict pain and only uses the fact that the victims are criminals as an excuse would probably be evil. But while she is obviously enjoying the process, I do think her endgoal is definitely actually getting rid of dark magick users, otherwise she wouldn't be so strict about only doing it to people she knows for sure are guilty.
